commit_message:
Fix import method to follow community guideline

Instead of "from i18n import _ 
            from i18n import _LE"
this style "from i18n import _, _LE" is recommended as community guideline [1].
[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#real-world-import-order-examples

Change-Id: I6c49be4f26b9be39972f5aa65240e94dee838e2d

subject: test_migration: use correct backend for cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 07:53:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/commit/09188819587e8c4425b94d388252a54a2431de0c', 'message': 'test_migration: Fix test migration setup

In 2ad571c8d7a7e1d8d18f7c5e97c564509fd34816 we have changed the backend
used for setup/cleanup the ModelsMigrationsSync by the one from
oslo_db.sqlalchemy.provision.

But in ModelsMigrationsSync nothing use the provisioning system. The
engine is created outside oslo.db. And oslo.db must must not assume
it have been created by the oslo_db.sqlalchemy.provision module.

For example, 2ad571c8d7a7e1d8d18f7c5e97c564509fd34816 have broken the
Gnocchi models migration test that creates the engine itself.

Change-Id: I8aa75b5c982100497a809c755585c9a5e11773de
Closes-bug: #1647280
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-05 08:45:44.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/sqlalchemy/test_migrations.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/commit/7a65f4d23be578de9ff4b49252a396a1e4f9f660', 'message': 'test_migration: use correct backend for cleanup

In 2ad571c8d7a7e1d8d18f7c5e97c564509fd34816 we have changed the backend
used to cleanup the ModelsMigrationsSync by the one from
oslo_db.sqlalchemy.provision.

But in ModelsMigrationsSync, nothing uses the provisioning system. The
engine can be created outside oslo.db. And oslo.db must must not assume
it have been created by the oslo_db.sqlalchemy.provision module.

For example, 2ad571c8d7a7e1d8d18f7c5e97c564509fd34816 have broken the
Gnocchi models migration test that creates the engine itself.

This change restore the previous assumption that expected self.db to
point to the current database object.

Change-Id: I8aa75b5c982100497a809c755585c9a5e11773de
Closes-bug: #1647280
'}]
commit_message:
test_migration: use correct backend for cleanup

In 2ad571c8d7a7e1d8d18f7c5e97c564509fd34816 we have changed the backend
used to cleanup the ModelsMigrationsSync by the one from
oslo_db.sqlalchemy.provision.

But in ModelsMigrationsSync, nothing uses the provisioning system. The
engine can be created outside oslo.db. And oslo.db must must not assume
it have been created by the oslo_db.sqlalchemy.provision module.

For example, 2ad571c8d7a7e1d8d18f7c5e97c564509fd34816 have broken the
Gnocchi models migration test that creates the engine itself.

This change restore the previous assumption that expected self.db to
point to the current database object.

Change-Id: I8aa75b5c982100497a809c755585c9a5e11773de
Closes-bug: #1647280
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db refs/changes/79/406779/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: from oslo_db.sqlalchemy import provision backend = provision.Backend.backend_for_database_type( self.get_engine().name) self.addCleanup(functools.partial(backend.drop_all_objects,

commit_message:
Force scala 2.11.6 for Ubuntu Trusty

The newer deb from scala-project.org (2.12.0, and probably the future ones)
depends on openjdk-8 which is only available on xenial.

Closes-Bug: #1644799
Change-Id: I3300bdc37f8da5b803ed2f311e39fe305b15d269
(cherry picked from commit bdd0c5c61d0edc5d1f6f4124469bf41eb2a746b2)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-image-elements refs/changes/75/403075/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ "trusty" == "${DIB_RELEASE}" ]; then # scale >= 2.12 for ubuntu depends on openjdk-8, not available on trustyelse VERSION="$(curl -s --fail http://www.scala-lang.org|grep 'scala-version'|grep -Eo '([0-9]\.?)+')" if [ $? != 0 -o -z "${VERSION}" ]; then echo "Installing default version $DEF_VERSION" VERSION=${DEF_VERSION} fi
deleted_lines: VERSION="$(curl -s --fail http://www.scala-lang.org|grep 'scala-version'|grep -Eo '([0-9]\.?)+')" if [ $? != 0 -o -z "${VERSION}" ]; then echo "Installing default version $DEF_VERSION"

commit_message:
Add project_id_param variable

In CredClients class, self.project_id_param is used as no defined.
We should declare this variable to make the code more intuitive.
We can add project_id_param = 'tenantId' or
project_id_param = 'project_id', the two are same as it will be
covered in sub class.

Change-Id: Idf7a04e93e357c48f60b35b3753e26c66e76499f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/73/384973/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: project_id_param = 'tenantId'

commit_message:
Turn off tempest's multitenant network tests

This disables the multitenant networking tests that come from tempest's
tree, but not the ones in ironic's tempest plugin.

Change-Id: I62cc4ae3e9fe7dc63ec4373535fe6ae07084a381
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/67/397767/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(jroll) this disables multitenant network tests from tempest's # tree, but not from our tree. This is a bit inconsistent, we should # fix it. iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG network shared_physical_network True

commit_message:
Introduce objects_exist method in neutron/objects/base.py

This patch introduces objects_exist method in neutron/objects/base.py.

The purpose of this patch: During OVO integration, there are
instances where we need to check whether an object is present
or not. Instead of writing custom methods based on get_objects,
this objects_exist method can be used.

Change-Id: I2546c31ef4a81c1e34dfaade97f93407910e0985
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
Remove unused trusty jobs

Some repos like inception, i18n, intel-nfv-ci-tests, kwapi,
manila-image-elements and others have no stable
branches. Thus these repositories will never run the trusty jobs.

Remove these extra unused jobs.

Change-Id: I22953aee080ec9da07d689e1deca7fdcd0e4536f

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-28 02:33:04.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/_exts/generate_validations_doc.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations/commit/21b63edb1f31cd139fcf7c8db874c6f3396d2ef5', 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable. 2.In py2, the performance about list
should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ib0b94e13c0f3cfebe5ce84dfadd850d0143b2de5
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable. 2.In py2, the performance about list
should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ib0b94e13c0f3cfebe5ce84dfadd850d0143b2de5

commit_message:
Fix duplicate declaration

User configures Username(root) and Home directory(/root) in
Operating System Access, and will throw the error that
Credentials_file[/root/openrc] is already declared in deployment.

Change-Id: I6f437550edd78af372e5f52b55663beab86edfee
Closes-Bug: #1636472

added_lines: module Puppet::Parser::Functions newfunctions(:create_cred_files,:type => :rvalue, :doc => <<-EOS Create credentials files EOS ) do |arguments| raise(Puppet::ParseError, 'No data provided!') if argument.size != 2 owners = arguments[0] params = arguments[1] owners.keys().uniq.each do |home_dir| params["owner"]=owners[home_dir] params["group"]=owners[home_dir] parameter = { home_dir => params } function_create_resources(['osnailyfacter::credentials_file', params]) end end

It seems that if not CONF.service_available.neutron, we raise
skipException. This is to add missing not.

commit_message:
Inventory refactor SystemExit uses removed

The use of SystemExit exceptions in what is effectively library code
has been eliminated. A new exception is introduced and it is handled
with a translation to a SystemExit within generate.py when
appropriate.

When attempting to load an existing inventory, a tuple is returned
instead of simply the inventory. The tuple includes the path used to
load the inventory, or an appropriate path. This facilitates saving
to the correct place with save_inventory later.

Use of dir_find within generate.py was also eliminated and the logic
around path to configuration should be simpler now.

One debug logging message was adjusted to only run when the desired
file is actually loaded, where it was always trying to log a message
even if not file was found previously.

The manage.py file had imports updated to replicate the pattern used
in generate.py

Change-Id: I9caecfa09517a508882ae491df9e3d2da9386012
Parent-Id: I577cdbf4aadfcce846412edd7e2a394c257c0243
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/53/400453/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # Inventory is necessary since keys are assumed present self.inv = fs.load_inventory(TARGET_DIR, di.INVENTORY_SKEL)

  ...]

Change-Id: I592035f7e37adee375f1530d4fbc28107870b089
Closes-Bug: 1616240

commit_message:
Deal with CONF.config_dir correctly

When config_dir is set, we were seeing this error:
  execv() arg 2 must contain only strings

We got this debug log:
  ['sudo', 'nova-rootwrap', ... ,
  '--config-file', '/nova/nova.conf', '--config-dir', ['/etc/nova'],
  ...]

Change-Id: I592035f7e37adee375f1530d4fbc28107870b089
Closes-Bug: 1616240
(cherry picked from commit 1666d9153a3b064c95e9fcaa6c3d77b926517a9c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.privsep refs/changes/04/406504/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for cfg_dir in cfg.CONF.config_dir: cmd.extend(['--config-dir', cfg_dir])

commit_message:
Remove agent vendor passthru from most drivers

This patch removes the deprecated agent lookup/heartbeat as vendor
passthru functionality from most of the drivers in following modules:
- ironic.drivers.agent
- ironic.drivers.pxe
- ironic.drivers.drac
- ironic.drivers.irmc

Some drivers are left untouched though:
- iLO and OneView drivers are a bit more complicated and will be fixed
  in follow-up patches
- iBoot, WoL and AMT drivers will be fixed in ironic-staging-drivers
  repo first and then removed from ironic tree.

Change-Id: Ia9ee46cda68ef823d1fe8e5ea03c1d5948810a50
Partial-Bug: #1640533

commit_message:
Force trusty on Spark, Vanilla and Storm Ubuntu images

The other images (Ambari, CDH, MapR) do not support Xenial.
Spark depends on CDH, and while Vanilla and Storm may support Xenial,
there are other packages and dependencies that need to be fixed first.

Change-Id: Ied720e35d2a5372f228861b104cca1afddaf26f9
(cherry picked from commit 9ac38b939ae8cfea8c2ad62dffce78a1ca0fc2f0)

commit_message:
api-ref: Deprecate the server actions to get consoles in v2.5

The blueprint consolidate-console-api introduced a consolidated REST API
for the different console types RDP, VNC, SERIAL, SPICE. This superseded
the different server actions to get these consoles, therefore they got
deprecated in microversion 2.5. Microversion 2.6 offers then the unified
console API:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/api_microversion_history.html#id5

This change adds the deprecation notes to the server actions.

part of bp:consolidate-console-api

Change-Id: If126791c3efbc9bb820771f84aecbea20ca0b9a1

subject: Allow X-History-Location versioned_writes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-30 11:18:54.000000000', 'files': ['templates/proxy-server.conf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/swift-versioned-writes-middleware-0b529e3cf2fb493d.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_swift/commit/de7ab0a8004a3e8a3c2912d04cb31a100d6d1a9e', 'message': 'Allow X-History-Location versioned_writes

Versioned Objects in Swift now use a middleware that is added to the
pipeline instead of the "allow_versions" in the container config. These
have 2 different Headers, so to prevent "X-Versions-Location" from not
working the "allow_versions" in the container config is left in place.

This patch adds the middleware by default and sets the Versioned Objects
support to be on. This is the upstream default and the deployer would
still need to set the "X-History-Location" header on a container to
utilise the feature.

Change-Id: I88811fd77fad8d2241448ca5ffb565fa7d704a00
'}]
commit_message:
Allow X-History-Location versioned_writes

Versioned Objects in Swift now use a middleware that is added to the
pipeline instead of the "allow_versions" in the container config. These
have 2 different Headers, so to prevent "X-Versions-Location" from not
working the "allow_versions" in the container config is left in place.

This patch adds the middleware by default and sets the Versioned Objects
support to be on. This is the upstream default and the deployer would
still need to set the "X-History-Location" header on a container to
utilise the feature.

Change-Id: I88811fd77fad8d2241448ca5ffb565fa7d704a00
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_swift refs/changes/30/404730/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Swift ``versioned_writes`` middleware is added to the pipeline by default. Additionally the ``allow_versioned_writes`` settings in the middleware configuration is set to ``True``. This follows the Swift defaults, and enables the use of the ``X-History-Location`` metadata Header.

added_lines: from optparse import OptionParserdef get_data_from_hiera(hiera_key, lookup_type='priority'): """ Extract the data from Hiera using the Ruby call. Yes, it looks funny but other ways to do it are worse. I have to use the Ruby implementation of hiera here with the Puppet config file. :param lookup_type: Which lookup type should be used? # priority, hash, array :type lookup_type: str :param hiera_key: the key to search :type hiera_key: str :return: hiera data :rtype: None, str, list, dict """ hiera_lookup = ''' ruby -r hiera -r yaml -e ' hiera = Hiera.new(:config => "/etc/puppet/hiera.yaml"); data = hiera.lookup("{hiera_key}", nil, {{}}, nil, :{lookup_type}); puts YAML.dump data; ' ''' try: command = hiera_lookup.format( hiera_key=hiera_key, lookup_type=lookup_type, ) response = subprocess.Popen( command, shell=True, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, ) yaml_data = yaml.load(response.stdout.read()) return yaml_data except subprocess.CalledProcessError as exception: logging.warn('Could not get Hiera data: {} Code: {} Output: {}'.format( hiera_key, exception.returncode, exception.output, )) return Nonedef main(): credentials = get_data_from_hiera('access', 'hash') ssl = get_data_from_hiera('use_ssl', 'hash') if ssl: auth_protocol = 'https://' auth_url = ssl['keystone_internal_hostname'] auth_port = ':5000/v2.0/' else: auth_protocol = 'http://' auth_url = ifilter(None, IP).next() auth_port = ':5000/v2.0/' AUTH_URL = auth_protocol + auth_url + auth_port parser = OptionParser() vcenter_settings = get_data_from_hiera('vcenter', 'hash')
deleted_lines: import optparsedef get_data_from_hiera(key, resolution_type=':priority'): cmd = 'ruby -r hiera -r yaml -e \'hiera = Hiera.new(:config => \ "/etc/puppet/hiera.yaml"); data = hiera.lookup "'+key+'", \ [], {}, nil, '+resolution_type+'; puts YAML.dump data\'' try: cmd_data = subprocess.Popen(cmd, shell=True, stdout=subprocess.PIPE) except subprocess.CalledProcessError as err: print("Error code", err.returncode, err.output) sys.exit(1) data = yaml.load(cmd_data.stdout.read()) return data def main(): credentials = get_data_from_hiera('access', ':hash') AUTH_URL = "http://" + ifilter(None, IP).next() + ":5000/v2.0/" parser = optparse.OptionParser() vcenter_settings = get_data_from_hiera('vcenter', ':hash')

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 14.0.4

SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/ab0913d479d473d2ccd2864614f3ce25

Change-Id: Iaa5a4acef8aa4d8162e32971eb6251e6c3175e5f

subject: Change the oslo vmware requirement
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 07:29:32.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/5fe88ca7dff864c9b7295ccf6714f58a3a1a3193', 'message': 'Change the oslo vmware requirement

Networking-vSphere requires some changes in oslo vmware which is
available in oslo.vmware 2.15.0 release.

In order to change the Networking-vSphere requirement, we need to change
the openstack global-requirement also to use oslo.vmware 2.15.0 or later
version.

This patch set changes the global-requirement to use oslo.vmware 2.15.0
and later version.

Change-Id: I965e3809cd5f79e47dfa6465081c63dd616d6227
'}]
commit_message:
Change the oslo vmware requirement

Networking-vSphere requires some changes in oslo vmware which is
available in oslo.vmware 2.15.0 release.

In order to change the Networking-vSphere requirement, we need to change
the openstack global-requirement also to use oslo.vmware 2.15.0 or later
version.

This patch set changes the global-requirement to use oslo.vmware 2.15.0
and later version.

Change-Id: I965e3809cd5f79e47dfa6465081c63dd616d6227

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 13.3.10

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Change-Id: I8cb24bc6ee44772e7be1a1c6ec287228d655d7f0
Depends-On: Ie0780b815481bb4906615d5db5a36b0d78e4bbe9

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/559465d22e07c31d0b932bba6ba62b7b

Change-Id: I77ab202260824ec33f22a0153776fe1baa1cd120

commit_message:
Add duplicate action id validation

This validation exists in the Java validation code for Alarm
Definitions, but not in the python code so add it.

Added tests for validation of other fields of the alarm definition
as well

Change-Id: I9636aa7525cd9957fd6357d6b076adb4db8d713c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api refs/changes/56/396756/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # (C) Copyright 2015-2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development LPimport monasca_api.v2.common.schemas.alarm_definition_request_body_schema as schemas_alarm_defs class TestAlarmDefinitionValidation(unittest.TestCase): def setUp(self): self.full_alarm_definition = ( {"name": self._create_string_of_length(255), "expression": "min(cpu.idle_perc) < 10", "description": self._create_string_of_length(255), "severity": "MEDIUM", "match_by": ["hostname"], "ok_actions:": [self._create_string_of_length(50)], "undetermined_actions": [self._create_string_of_length(50)], "alarm_actions": [self._create_string_of_length(50)], "actions_enabled": True}) def _create_string_of_length(self, length): s = '' for i in xrange(0, length): s += str(i % 10) return s def test_validation_good_minimum(self): alarm_definition = {"name": "MyAlarmDefinition", "expression": "min(cpu.idle_perc) < 10"} try: schemas_alarm_defs.validate(alarm_definition) except schemas_exceptions.ValidationException as e: self.fail("shouldn't happen: {}".format(str(e))) def test_validation_good_full(self): alarm_definition = self.full_alarm_definition try: schemas_alarm_defs.validate(alarm_definition) except schemas_exceptions.ValidationException as e: self.fail("shouldn't happen: {}".format(str(e))) def _ensure_fails_with_new_value(self, name, value): alarm_definition = self.full_alarm_definition.copy() alarm_definition[name] = value self._ensure_validation_fails(alarm_definition) def _ensure_validation_fails(self, alarm_definition): self.assertRaises( schemas_exceptions.ValidationException, schemas_alarm_defs.validate, alarm_definition) def _run_duplicate_action_test(self, actions_type): actions = ["a", "b", "a"] self._ensure_fails_with_new_value(actions_type, actions) def test_validation_too_long_name(self): self._ensure_fails_with_new_value("name", self._create_string_of_length(256)) def test_validation_too_long_description(self): self._ensure_fails_with_new_value("description", self._create_string_of_length(256)) def test_validation_duplicate_ok_actions(self): self._run_duplicate_action_test("ok_actions") def test_validation_duplicate_alarm_actions(self): self._run_duplicate_action_test("alarm_actions") def test_validation_duplicate_undetermined_actions(self): self._run_duplicate_action_test("undetermined_actions") def test_validation_too_many_actions(self): actions = [self._create_string_of_length(51)] self._ensure_fails_with_new_value("ok_actions", actions) def test_validation_invalid_severity(self): self._ensure_fails_with_new_value("severity", "BOGUS") def test_validation_invalid_match_by(self): self._ensure_fails_with_new_value("match_by", "BOGUS") def test_validation_invalid_actions_enabled(self): self._ensure_fails_with_new_value("actions_enabled", 42)

commit_message:
Chnage exception type for policy type not found

This patch changes the exception type raised from "SpecValidationFailed"
to "ResourceNotFound" (the default) when a policy type could not be
found.

Change-Id: I69985e0b5f9142a30b148316e59433468d409258

commit_message:
Update swiftclient to 3.2.0

swiftclient 3.2.0 is the first swiftclient to support keystoneauth
sessions. This will hugely simplify interacting with swift from services
as most already support sessions.

Change-Id: Ia518c2db9d0163d67d1f6fae11a81ae769c1e8ac

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/797e9719287a915ff18e6af10eb8b54f

Change-Id: Idbaa575cd45c6152bb9e1049b567157aa0ad3692

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-01 17:24:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security/commit/bf2c343af28c374077cd3dc18a65b9a43a22c2c8', 'message': "Apply pam_faillock restrictions [+Docs]

This patch applies pam_faillock restrictions to Red Hat and CentOS servers.
It's an optional change since it could cause issues with existing production
deployments.

Ubuntu doesn't have pam_faillock, but it may be possible to use fail2ban to
achieve some of the same goals later.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig

This patch applies pam_faillock restrictions to Red Hat and CentOS servers.

commit_message:
Apply pam_faillock restrictions [+Docs]

This patch applies pam_faillock restrictions to Red Hat and CentOS servers.
It's an optional change since it could cause issues with existing production
deployments.

Ubuntu doesn't have pam_faillock, but it may be possible to use fail2ban to
achieve some of the same goals later.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: Ib2d22deff2d97786b84a550313f6ca08cf10cef8

added_lines: # Disable user accounts if the password expires. security_disable_account_if_password_expires: no # RHEL-07-010280 # Lock user accounts with excessive login failures. See documentation. security_pam_faillock_enable: no # RHEL-07-010371 security_pam_faillock_interval: 900 security_pam_faillock_attempts: 3 security_pam_faillock_deny_root: yes

commit_message:
Add alt text for badges

The RST image directive takes an alt parameter that's used to supply an
alt attribute for the HTML image element that's generated during RST
to HTML conversion.  The alt text is useful for accessibility purposes
and is also displayed if the image source is unavailable when the HTML
is generated.  Because of the latter point, we can't rely on the
accessibility features of the SVG image, we need to maintain some info
here in the README.rst file.

Change-Id: I598a99237b8581995e79be96172a42a752107357

Implements: blueprint create-volume-from-source-enhancement
'}]
commit_message:
Enhancement of volume creation from source vol

This feature is to allow creating volume from source vol
in diffeent volume hosts or with different encryptions.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I1ad63b8cf63a9fd32bf25b87be7bb0968944b853
Implements: blueprint create-volume-from-source-enhancement
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/16/315316/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================= Create volume from source vol in different storages ============================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/create-volume-from-source-enhancement Enable creating volume from source vol in different storages or with different encryptions. Problem description =================== Currently it only allows to create volume from source vol in same storage. Use Cases ========= * Customers creates a volume in a storage device from another volume which is in another storage device. * Customers creates a volume from another volume but both volumes have different encryptions. Proposed change =============== Above user cases it needs data migration. When creating from source vol with specified volume type, it checks whether new volume is created in same volume host with same encryptions. If yes, nothing needs to chanage. If no, it needs data migration. Use following steps to create the new volume. * Create a temporary cloned volume from source vol. * RPC call to create destination volume with specified volume type. * Set temp_volume_id in the new volume. * Map both volume to volume host. If any volume is encrypted, it needs to attach encryptors. * Data migration. * Delete temporary cloned volume and unset temp_volume_id. If error happens in above steps, the temporary cloned volume is deleted the field temp_volume_id is unset, and status of new volume is set to error. Meanwhile, it needs resource cleanup during volume host starts, except set creating volumes to error, it needs to check temp_volume_id field, and cleans temporary volumes if exist. Alternatives ------------ Create new volume in same storage and retype. It needs user to do it in two steps. Data model impact ----------------- Add a new field called temp_volume_id in table volumes. REST API impact --------------- Change the existing create API to take a new parameter called allow_data_migration. Only when this parameter is specified as True, it allows above enhanced operations. * Create volume * /v3/{tenant_id}/volumes * Method: POST * JSON schema definition for V3:: { "volume": { "size": "XXX", # existing "volume_type": "XXX", # existing "source_volid": "XXX", # existing "allow_data_migration": "True", #new } } Security impact --------------- If source volume and new volume have different encryptions, Cinder needs to access encryption keys and decrypt the data. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ It needs data migration and as a result more time to wait for new volume available. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: LisaLi <xiaoyan.li@intel.com> Work Items ---------- * Add new field temp_volume_id to volumes. * Add the steps to create volume from source vol in different storages. * Add encryptors attachment. [1] is needed. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Both unit and Tempest tests need to be created to cover the code change that mentioned in "Proposed change". Documentation Impact ==================== The cinder API documentation will need to be updated to describe the change. References ========== * [1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/247372/

Ces services interagissent en fonction des besoins de votre " "cloud. Il s'agit notamment du service Compute, du service d'Identité, du " "service Réseau, du service d'Image, du service de stockage par Blocs, du " "service de stockage Objet, du service de Télémétrie, du service " "d'Orchestration et du service de Base de Données. Les " "environnements à base de services autonomes comme le Stockage d'Objet ne " "peuvent pas utiliser le dashboard. Pour rendre les opérations client plus efficaces, " "OpenStack supporte des scripts d'environnement client simples également " "appelés fichiers OpenRC. Ces scripts contiennent généralement des options " "communes pour tous les clients, mais supportent aussi des options " "spécifiques. Par défaut, ce rôle restreint les opérations :term:`API <Application ""rôle à des utilisateurs ayant le rôle ``heat_stack_owner``.""Pour connaitre le langage des templates, voir `le Guide des Templaces " "<http://docs.openstack.org/developer/heat/template_guide/index.html>`__ dans " "la `documentation développeur Heat <http://docs.openstack.org/developer/heat/""network_type flat`` connectent le réseau virtual plat au réseau physique ""informations des fichiers suivants:""L'utilisateur ``admin`` ou tout autre utilisateur avec privilèges doit créer " "ce réseau parce qu'il se connecte directement à l'infrastructure de réseau ""L'utilisateur ``demo`` ou tout autre utilisateur sans privilèges peut créer ""La commande ``systemctl restart`` démarre tous les services, s'ils ne sont " "pas déjà démarrés.""Le dashboard repose sur des services de base fonctionnels comme le service " "d'Identité, le service d'Image, le Compute, et soit le Réseau (neutron) ou " "le réseau legacy (nova-network). Les environnements avec des services " "autonomes comme le Stockage d'Objet ne peuvent pas utiliser le dashboard. " "Pour plus d'informations, voir la `documentation développeur <http://docs." "openstack.org/developer/ horizon/topics/deployment.html>`__.""L'instance doit pouvoir joindre l'adresse IP de management sur le nœud de ""client ``openstack``. Pour faciliter les opérations client, OpenStack " "supporte des scripts d'environnement client simples également appelés " "fichiers OpenRC. Ces scripts contiennent généralement des options communes " "pour tous les clients, mais supportent aussi des options uniques. Pour plus " "d'informations, voir le `Guide de l'Utilisateur Final OpenStack <http://docs." "openstack.org/user-guide/common/ ""permettre aux routeurs self-services de les utiliser pour se connecter aux " "réseaux externes comme internet. L'utilisateur ``admin`` ou autre ""8.8.4.4 pour la résolution DNS.""Le réseau self-service utilise 172.16.1.0/24 avec la passerelle sur ""172.16.1.2 et 172.16.1.254. Toutes les instances utilisent 8.8.4.4 pour la " "résolution DNS.""se termine avec sucés.""Il y a deux modes d'installation. Le premier utilise ``/horizon`` comme URL, " "garde votre vhost par défaut et ajoute seulement une directive Alias: c'est " "le mode par défaut. L'autre mode va supprimer le vhost Apache par défaut et " "installe le dashboard sur le webroot. C'était la seule option disponible " "avant la version Liberty. Si vous préférez définir manuellement la " "configuration Apache, installez le package ``openstack-dashboard`` à la " "place du ``openstack-dashboard-apache``.""``service``:""Ce guide utilise le serveur HTTP Apache avec l'option ``mod_wsgi`` pour " "répondre aux requêtes de service d'Identité sur les ports 5000 et 35357. Par " "défaut, le service keystone écoute toujours sur ces ports. Par conséquent, " "ce guide désactive manuellement le service keystone. ""Ce guide présente une installation à l'aide des packages disponibles avec " "Debian 8 (nom de code: Jessie).""disponibles sur Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 et ses dérivés via les dépôts RDO.""Cloud Open Build Service.""Ce guide présente une installation à l'aide des packages disponibles via le " "dépôt d'archive Cloud Ubuntu de Canonical.""La sortie devrait indiquer quatre composants \"head-engine\" sur le nœud ""Cette section suppose la bonne installation, configuration, et " "fonctionnement du service d'Identité utilisant le serveur HTTP Apache et le " "service Memcached comme décrit dans la section :ref:`Installer et configurer " "le service d'Identité <keystone-install>`.""question de performance, cette configuration déploie des tokens Fernet et le ""d'Orchestration, nom de code heat, sur le nœud contrôleur.""nœud contrôleur.""Cette section utilises l'image ``manila-service-image`` comme instance pour "msgstr "Pour créer la base de données, effectuer les opérations suivantes:""Pour exécuter les clients en tant que projet et utilisateur spécifique, il ""lancer. Par exemple:""Pour utiliser le client VNC avec le tableau de bord, le navigateur doit " "supporter les canvas et les WebSockets d'HTML5.""Vider les variables d'environnement temporaires ``OS_TOKEN`` et ``OS_URL``:""`bare`, et une visibilité publique pour que tous les projets puissent y " "accéder:""installation en mode non-interactif ou si vous ne spécifiez pas ce token, ""launchpad.net/cirros>`__, une image linux minimale qui vous permettra de ""provider>` avant le réseau self-service.""environnement dans les chapitres suivantes.""Votre environnement OpenStack inclut maintenant le Tableau de bord. Vous " "pouvez :ref:`launch-instance` ou ajouter d'autres services à votre " "environnement."msgstr "``linuxbridge_agent.ini``:"msgstr "``ml2_conf.ini``:"

commit_message:
Integrate Address Scope OVO into DB

This change take advantage of the use of Oslo-Versioned Objects for
Address Scope class.

Co-Authored-By: Ankur Gupta <ankur.gupta@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Mohit Malik <mohit.malik@intel.com>

Change-Id: I7d063b23f45c65c91750c4482817dd372ea1ac93
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
Update vmware_nsx version to 0.4.0

The version contains the following bug fixes:
1. Ensure that target type is configurable for exclude list
2. Support paginated responses from the NSX
3. Add support for firewall exclude list
4. Ensure that correct exception is raised
5. Fix router name update

Change-Id: I5d5f92cbe19ba94d390c6fecbff1ae2083231657

commit_message:
Fix removing node layout

* removing node has the same styles as offline node
* removing node can not be deleted from environment
* configuration of disks or interfaces is not available
  for removing node
* removing node is not selectable

Closes-Bug: #1644209

Change-Id: Ia61716aaae4eb07786e1790a355da3b383e9f95e

commit_message:
Fix removing node layout

* removing node has the same styles as offline node
* removing node can not be deleted from environment
* configuration of disks or interfaces is not available
  for removing node
* removing node is not selectable

Closes-Bug: #1644209

Change-Id: Ia61716aaae4eb07786e1790a355da3b383e9f95e

commit_message:
Use fake uuid for uuid field in unit test

otherwise, we will see some warning like:
is an invalid UUID. Using UUIDFields with invalid UUIDs is
no longer supported in the unit test result

Change-Id: I4bbc42b5839f95e953da269d843557066369647f

commit_message:
EDP engine Swift fix for HDP 2.2

The Swift jar is added to oozie workflow by an absolute path as a
workarund for Pig Launcher classpath issue.

Partially-implements-blueprint: hdp-22-support
Change-Id: I8c77e598b4e889bb63918b37971ebe867af67314
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/04/200504/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # limitations under the License import copy from sahara import conductor from sahara import contextconductor = conductor.API def run_job(self, job_execution): ctx = context.ctx() job = conductor.job_get(ctx, job_execution.job_id) if job.type == "Pig": input_ds = conductor.data_source_get(ctx, job_execution.input_id) output_ds = conductor.data_source_get(ctx, job_execution.output_id) if input_ds.type == "swift" or output_ds.type == "swift": cluster = conductor.cluster_get(ctx, job_execution.cluster_id) job_execution = self._set_additional_jar(cluster, job_execution) return super(EDPOozieEngine, self).run_job(job_execution) def _set_additional_jar(self, cluster, job_execution): ctx = context.ctx() oozie = plugin_utils.get_instance(cluster, p_common.OOZIE_SERVER) with oozie.remote() as r: code, jar_path = r.execute_command( ('find /usr/hdp -name "hadoop-openstack.jar" 2>/dev/null ' '-print | head -n 1'), run_as_root=True) values = {"job_configs": {"configs": {}}} values["job_configs"]["configs"]["pig.additional.jars"] = jar_path updated_je = conductor.job_execution_update(ctx, job_execution, values) return updated_je

commit_message:
Fix unique name validation

The name validation now checks resources within the tenant.

Change-Id: Iffcca842875827bf61200abde423cbb1a1a89cd6
Closes-bug: #1584680

commit_message:
Angularize node tables

This patch implements node table and detail page based on AngularJS.
As a related patch, I'll implement create/update/delete actions.

Change-Id: I38f5e4b7cc92e5c34f67ae83348381eb28a59d62
Partial-Implements: blueprint angularize-node-table

commit_message:
Update network_cidr config option doc

It was changed by this commit I1393d65ffb20b1396ff068def237418958ed3289
and it wasn't updated at the time.

Change-Id: I3d31c5d2d51721b20737e99eff019a723b5515b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/67/405967/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # instances. This should be the subnet used for PXE booting. (string # value)
deleted_lines: # instances. This should be the subnet used for PXE booting. The # current default for this value is 192.168.24.0/24. If an # overcloud has already been deployed with the 192.168.24.0/24 CIDR and # therefore the CIDR cannot be changed, you must set this option to # 192.168.24.0/24 explicitly to avoid it changing in future releases, and # all other network options related to the CIDR (e.g. local_ip) must # also be set to maintain a valid configuration. (string value)

commit_message:
Fix removing node layout

* removing node has the same styles as offline node
* removing node can not be deleted from environment
* configuration of disks or interfaces is not available
  for removing node
* removing node is not selectable

Closes-Bug: #1644209

Change-Id: Ia61716aaae4eb07786e1790a355da3b383e9f95e

commit_message:
ITRI DISCO cinder backup driver

This commit adds a Cinder backup driver for ITRI DISCO product.

The DISCO backup driver supports the following features:

* Backup any volume from any drivers to DISCO backend
* It will be incremental backup if it is a backup of a DISCO volume
* Restore a backup from DISCO storage system

It also includes the unit tests.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint disco-backup-driver-cinder

Change-Id: Ide6e1e6d994d91a63d103bd8ce5e9edee37b7408

added_lines: # (c) Copyright 2016 Industrial Technology Research Institute. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Test cases to test a DISCO to DISCO backup.""" import copy import mock import time import uuid from cinder import db from cinder import exception from cinder.tests.unit.backup.drivers import disco from cinder.tests.unit import utils as utils from cinder.volume.drivers.disco import disco as disco_driver from cinder.volume.drivers.disco import disco_api class DISCOToDISCOBackupTestCase(disco.TestDISCOBackupDriver): """Test cases for DISCO backup.""" def _create_volume_db_entry(self, id, size): vol = {'id': id, 'size': size, 'status': 'available'} return db.volume_create(self.ctxt, vol)['id'] def _create_backup_db_entry(self, backupid, volid, size, userid=str(uuid.uuid4()), projectid=str(uuid.uuid4())): backup = {'id': backupid, 'size': size, 'volume_id': volid, 'user_id': userid, 'project_id': projectid} return db.backup_create(self.ctxt, backup)['id'] def setUp(self): """Initialise variables and mock functions.""" super(DISCOToDISCOBackupTestCase, self).setUp() self.volume_file = disco.FakeVolumeFile('/dev/dms1234567') # Mock the source volume self.mock_object(db.sqlalchemy.api, 'volume_get', self.get_fake_volume) self.ip_address = '127.0.0.1' self.port = 9898 self.client = disco_api.DISCOAPI(self.ip_address, self.port) self.param = {'backup_id': '1234'} self.start_time = int(time.time()) self.disco_check = disco_driver.DISCOCheck( self.client, self.param, self.start_time, 'backup_detail') self.fake_affect_backup_policy_response = { 'standard': { 'success': {'status': 0, 'result': 'affected the backup policy'}, 'fail': {'status': 1, 'result': 'an error message'}} } self.fake_do_backup_response = { 'standard': { 'success': {'status': 0, 'result': '123'}, 'fail': {'status': 1, 'result': 'an error message'}} } backup_detail_response = { 'status': 0, 'backupDetail': {'backupId': 1234, 'status': 0} } backup_success = copy.deepcopy(backup_detail_response) backup_pending = copy.deepcopy(backup_detail_response) backup_fail = copy.deepcopy(backup_detail_response) backup_response_fail = copy.deepcopy(backup_detail_response) backup_success['backupDetail']['status'] = ( self.DETAIL_OPTIONS['success']) backup_pending['backupDetail']['status'] = ( self.DETAIL_OPTIONS['pending']) backup_fail['backupDetail']['status'] = ( self.DETAIL_OPTIONS['failure']) backup_response_fail['status'] = 1 self.fake_backup_detail_response = { 'backup_detail': { 'success': backup_success, 'fail': backup_fail, 'pending': backup_pending, 'request_fail': backup_response_fail } } self.test_pending = False self.test_pending_count = 0 self.is_disco = True self.affect_bp_response = \ self.fake_affect_backup_policy_response['standard']['success'] self.do_backup_response = \ self.fake_do_backup_response['standard']['success'] self.volume_info = self.volume_info_responses['success'] self.monitor_backup_status = \ self.fake_backup_detail_response['backup_detail']['success'] def fake_source_volume_type(self, *cmd, **kwargs): """Mock function is_file_disco.""" return self.is_disco def get_volume_information(self, *cmd, **kwargs): """Mock function _get_volume_information.""" return self.volume_info def affect_backup_policy_to_volume(self, *cmd, **kwargs): """Mock function affect backup policy.""" return self.affect_bp_response def do_backup(self, *cmd, **kwargs): """Mock function backup_create.""" return self.do_backup_response def monitor_end_backup(self, *cmd, **kwargs): """Mock function monitor_end_backup.""" if not self.test_pending: return self.monitor_backup_status if self.test_pending_count == 0: self.test_pending_count += 1 return self.fake_backup_detail_response['backup_detail']['pending'] else: return self.fake_backup_detail_response['backup_detail']['success'] def backup_disco_to_disco(self): """Test the method to backup a disco volume to a disco backend.""" self.driver.backup(self.backup, self.volume_file, False) def test_backup_disco_to_disco(self): """Test the method to backup a disco volume to a disco backend.""" with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_file_is_disco') as \ mock_file_is_disco: mock_file_is_disco.side_effect = self.fake_source_volume_type with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'volume_detail_by_id') as \ mock_volume_detail: mock_volume_detail.side_effect = self.get_volume_information self.volume_info['volumeInfoResult']['backupPolicyId'] = \ self.DEFAULT_BACKUP_POLICY with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'backup_create') as \ mock_do_backup: mock_do_backup.side_effect = self.do_backup with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_monitor_end_backup') as \ mock_monitor_backup: mock_monitor_backup.side_effect = \ self.monitor_end_backup self.backup_disco_to_disco() self.assertTrue(mock_file_is_disco.called) self.assertTrue(mock_volume_detail.called) self.assertTrue(mock_do_backup.called) self.assertTrue(mock_monitor_backup.called) def test_backup_disco_to_disco_affect_backup_policy(self): """Test to backup a disco volume by affecting a backup policy.""" with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_file_is_disco') as \ mock_file_is_disco: mock_file_is_disco.side_effect = self.fake_source_volume_type with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'volume_detail_by_id') as \ mock_volume_detail: mock_volume_detail.side_effect = self.get_volume_information with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'affect_backup_policy_to_volume') as \ mock_affect: mock_affect.side_effect = \ self.affect_backup_policy_to_volume with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'backup_create') as \ mock_do_backup: mock_do_backup.side_effect = self.do_backup with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_monitor_end_backup') as \ mock_monitor_backup: mock_monitor_backup.side_effect = \ self.monitor_end_backup self.backup_disco_to_disco() self.assertTrue(mock_file_is_disco.called) self.assertTrue(mock_volume_detail.called) self.assertTrue(mock_affect.called) self.assertTrue(mock_do_backup.called) self.assertTrue(mock_monitor_backup.called) def test_backup_disco_to_disco_affect_backup_policy_fail(self): """Fail to backup a disco volume by affecting a backup policy.""" self.affect_bp_response = \ self.fake_affect_backup_policy_response['standard']['fail'] with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_file_is_disco') as \ mock_file_is_disco: mock_file_is_disco.side_effect = self.fake_source_volume_type with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'volume_detail_by_id') as \ mock_volume_detail: mock_volume_detail.side_effect = self.get_volume_information with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'affect_backup_policy_to_volume') as \ mock_affect: mock_affect.side_effect = \ self.affect_backup_policy_to_volume with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'backup_create') as \ mock_do_backup: mock_do_backup.side_effect = self.do_backup with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_monitor_end_backup') as \ mock_monitor_backup: mock_monitor_backup.side_effect = \ self.monitor_end_backup self.assertRaises( exception.VolumeBackendAPIException, self.backup_disco_to_disco) self.assertTrue(mock_file_is_disco.called) self.assertTrue(mock_volume_detail.called) self.assertTrue(mock_affect.called) self.assertFalse(mock_do_backup.called) self.assertFalse(mock_monitor_backup.called) def test_backup_get_information_volume_fail(self): """Fail to get the volume's information during the backup.""" self.volume_info = self.volume_info_responses['fail'] with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_file_is_disco') as \ mock_file_is_disco: mock_file_is_disco.side_effect = self.fake_source_volume_type with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'volume_detail_by_id') as \ mock_volume_detail: mock_volume_detail.side_effect = self.get_volume_information with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'backup_create') as \ mock_do_backup: mock_do_backup.side_effect = self.do_backup with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_monitor_end_backup') as \ mock_monitor_backup: mock_monitor_backup.side_effect = \ self.monitor_end_backup self.assertRaises(exception.VolumeBackendAPIException, self.backup_disco_to_disco) self.assertTrue(mock_file_is_disco.called) self.assertTrue(mock_volume_detail.called) self.assertFalse(mock_do_backup.called) self.assertFalse(mock_monitor_backup.called) def test_do_backup_fail(self): """Fail to do the backup.""" self.do_backup_response = \ self.fake_do_backup_response['standard']['fail'] self.volume_info['volumeInfoResult']['backupPolicyId'] = \ self.DEFAULT_BACKUP_POLICY with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_file_is_disco') as \ mock_file_is_disco: mock_file_is_disco.side_effect = self.fake_source_volume_type with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'volume_detail_by_id') as \ mock_volume_detail: mock_volume_detail.side_effect = self.get_volume_information with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'backup_create') as \ mock_do_backup: mock_do_backup.side_effect = self.do_backup with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_monitor_end_backup') as \ mock_monitor_backup: mock_monitor_backup.side_effect = \ self.monitor_end_backup self.assertRaises(exception.VolumeBackendAPIException, self.backup_disco_to_disco) self.assertTrue(mock_file_is_disco.called) self.assertTrue(mock_volume_detail.called) self.assertTrue(mock_do_backup.called) self.assertFalse(mock_monitor_backup.called) def test_monitor_backup_request_fail(self): """Request to get the backup details return a failure.""" self.monitor_backup_status = \ self.fake_backup_detail_response['backup_detail']['request_fail'] with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_file_is_disco') as \ mock_file_is_disco: mock_file_is_disco.side_effect = self.fake_source_volume_type with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'volume_detail_by_id') as \ mock_volume_detail: mock_volume_detail.side_effect = self.get_volume_information self.volume_info['volumeInfoResult']['backupPolicyId'] = \ self.DEFAULT_BACKUP_POLICY with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'backup_create') as \ mock_backup_create: mock_backup_create.side_effect = self.do_backup with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'backup_detail') as \ mock_backup_detail: mock_backup_detail.side_effect = \ self.monitor_end_backup self.assertRaises(exception.VolumeBackendAPIException, self.backup_disco_to_disco) self.assertTrue(mock_file_is_disco.called) self.assertTrue(mock_volume_detail.called) self.assertTrue(mock_backup_create.called) self.assertTrue(mock_backup_detail.called) def test_monitor_backup_fail(self): """Request to DISCO failed when monitoring the backup details.""" self.monitor_backup_status = \ self.fake_backup_detail_response['backup_detail']['fail'] with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_file_is_disco') as \ mock_file_is_disco: mock_file_is_disco.side_effect = self.fake_source_volume_type with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'volume_detail_by_id') as \ mock_volume_detail: mock_volume_detail.side_effect = self.get_volume_information self.volume_info['volumeInfoResult']['backupPolicyId'] = \ self.DEFAULT_BACKUP_POLICY with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'backup_create') as \ mock_do_backup: mock_do_backup.side_effect = self.do_backup with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'backup_detail') as \ mock_backup_detail: mock_backup_detail.side_effect = \ self.monitor_end_backup self.assertRaises(exception.VolumeBackendAPIException, self.backup_disco_to_disco) self.assertTrue(mock_file_is_disco.called) self.assertTrue(mock_volume_detail.called) self.assertTrue(mock_do_backup.called) self.assertTrue(mock_backup_detail.called) def test_monitor_backup_pending(self): """Get backup details rquest return pending then success.""" self.test_pending = True with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_file_is_disco') as \ mock_file_is_disco: mock_file_is_disco.side_effect = self.fake_source_volume_type with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'volume_detail_by_id') as \ mock_volume_detail: mock_volume_detail.side_effect = self.get_volume_information self.volume_info['volumeInfoResult']['backupPolicyId'] = \ self.DEFAULT_BACKUP_POLICY with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'backup_create') as \ mock_backup_create: mock_backup_create.side_effect = self.do_backup with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'backup_detail') as \ mock_backup_detail: mock_backup_detail.side_effect = \ self.monitor_end_backup self.backup_disco_to_disco() self.assertTrue(mock_file_is_disco.called) self.assertTrue(mock_volume_detail.called) self.assertTrue(mock_backup_create.called) self.assertTrue(mock_backup_detail.called) @mock.patch.object(time, 'time') def test_monitor_backup_timeout(self, mock_time): """Backup detail request reaches timeout.""" timeout = 3 mock_time.side_effect = utils.generate_timeout_series(timeout) self.override_config("backup_check_timeout", timeout) self.monitor_backup_status = \ self.fake_backup_detail_response['backup_detail']['pending'] with mock.patch.object(self.driver, '_file_is_disco') as \ mock_file_is_disco: mock_file_is_disco.side_effect = self.fake_source_volume_type with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'volume_detail_by_id') as \ mock_volume_detail: mock_volume_detail.side_effect = self.get_volume_information self.volume_info['volumeInfoResult']['backupPolicyId'] = \ self.DEFAULT_BACKUP_POLICY with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'backup_create') as \ mock_backup_create: mock_backup_create.side_effect = self.do_backup with mock.patch.object(self.driver.disco_src_api, 'backup_detail') as \ mock_backup_detail: mock_backup_detail.side_effect = \ self.monitor_end_backup self.assertRaises(exception.VolumeBackendAPIException, self.backup_disco_to_disco) self.assertTrue(mock_file_is_disco.called) self.assertTrue(mock_volume_detail.called) self.assertTrue(mock_backup_create.called) self.assertTrue(mock_backup_detail.called)

commit_message:
[WIP]Report IPv4 capabilities for IP drivers

Please read spec for design detail:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/362786/

The patch list:
    1. Support IPv6 in allow_access&dummy,generic driver(312321)
    2. Report IPv4 capability in current drivers(this)
    3. Support IPv6 in huawei driver
    4. Support in manilaclient(328932)
    5. Seneraio tests
    6. Documentation

Change-Id: I163372b2ea6336b901856083b48579fcab4d75cd

commit_message:
Add pip and virtualenv upgrade to development guidelines

Change [1] requires pip >= 7.0.1. In general, test
environments will need to have pip and virtualenv in line
with global requirements. Add a reference to the global
requirements rather than specifying versions that will
inevitably become stale.

Also adds inline literal markup to all occurences of "tox"
for consistency.

[1] Related-Change: I7c60be623b4340ee34ae1aa520f17b303348811d

Change-Id: I7730f22c594a3521973cb9ff264a7d50f2b86a1a
Depends-On: I45eee626713438af5fc676f2b5f636d7ec23f7be

Zun: switch from "job" to "job-template"

same template.

Add new project: novajoin

This project is a nova metadata dynamic vendordata service to
aid in enrolling new instances as freeIPA clients.

commit_message:
puppet/tripleo: IRC channels cleanup

- Puppet OpenStack
  - remove Liberty and Juno that are EOL.
  - Remove puppet-tripleo, which is already on #tripleo channel.

commit_message:
Add fuel-plugin-nitrous project

Nitrous plugin will install Base OS, multipath options, create VMs and
their network settings for Fuel provisioning and deployment.

Change-Id: I54737c1d21923342864886b9ff64777a2b1ecd58

commit_message:
Make gate-manila-ui-dsvm-nv job run only for Ocata+ branches

Job 'gate-manila-ui-dsvm-nv' depends on code merged in Ocata (current
master) [1]. So, exclude this job from all existing stable branches
to avoid redundant waste of CI resources.

[1] Id564e4ea6b675aa197ae377aa7a756e1bd0625b6

Change-Id: I2c17c431662c4212dceae1a831f80938c589ad33

the log "LOG.error(_(..))"  still used in a few places.

commit_message:
Fixed job match pattern for skipping non-doc jobs for neutron-lib

Now that neutron-lib gate jobs have the -ubuntu-* ending, the old
pattern was not matching properly.

This can be observed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/404933/

Fixed it by allowing for -ubuntu-[trusty|xenial] ending.

Change-Id: I380edce8bdd4bf767cb753adc03b09c741f4cecb

commit_message:
networking-odl: remove periodic tempest liberty job

It turned out that
periodic-tempest-dsvm-networking-odl-{beryllium, boron}-snapshot-liberty
fail to run test. Since stable/liberty branch is about to be end of
life, there is no point to fix it, but remove those periodic jobs.
note: periodic-tempest-dsvm-networking-odl-boron-snapshot-mitaka
is able to run test and failed with some test cases.
It's another story to address it and to add new periodic jobs
with newton branch + new ODL version.

Change-Id: I5587f97a4b893c84492d01fe7f5d3efd068b41ab

remove django-openstack-auth-kerberos from infra

two point releases. Following the instruction at [1], the repo
now contains only a REAMDE.rst file [2].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#remove-project-from-infrastructure-systems

commit_message:
Add TripleO CI scenarios to Puppet gate

We tested TripleO CI scenario001 and scenario004 in puppet-ceph gate and
it works fine. This patch completes the work with other modules:

- Add scenario00(2,3)-multinode-puppet jobs in
  jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml.
- Create Zuul Layout for tripleo-scenario-jobs-scenario00(2,3) groups of
  jobs.
- tripleo scenario001 will be run for puppet-aodh, puppet-ceilometer,
  puppet-gnocchi and puppet-cinder.
- tripleo scenario002 will be run for puppet-barbican, puppet-swift,
  puppet-zaqar and puppet-cinder.
- tripleo scenario003 will be run for puppet-sahara, puppet-mistral and
  puppet-horizon.
- puppet-aodh, puppet-ceilometer, puppet-cinder, won't run
  tripleo-puppet-jobs layout anymore but it's on purpose.
- puppet-cinder will run tripleo ovb jobs for newton and mitaka only
  and scenario001 and 002 in ocata.

This patch is part of the efforts made in TripleO CI to have scenarios,
like we already have in Puppet CI. We also made our best to build
similar scenarios between TripleO and Puppet CIs, to bring consistency
in our tests.

Change-Id: I9af581195d1872cb5fd6f06802d6b8940e66645e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-25 13:20:31.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/openflow/native/ovs_ryuapp.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/949bce960d04ca541387aac9c787ca04af496df8', 'message': "ovs-agent: Close ryu app on all exceptions

Previous patch closes app only when ovs-agent raises an exception. This
leaves some corner cases where exceptions inheriting from BaseException

commit_message:
ovs-agent: Close ryu app on all exceptions

Previous patch closes app only when ovs-agent raises an exception. This
leaves some corner cases where exceptions inheriting from BaseException
are raised. It's better to be defensive and always close app on error.

Change-Id: Icaaaecc4d00e3a280c3af2e403499bb7ac9e8aa6
Related-bug: 1611237
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/69/402569/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: finally: # The following call terminates Ryu's AppManager.run_apps(), # which is needed for clean shutdown of an agent process. # The close() call must be called in another thread, otherwise # it suicides and ends prematurely. hub.spawn(app_manager.AppManager.get_instance().close)
deleted_lines: # The following call terminates Ryu's AppManager.run_apps(), # which is needed for clean shutdown of an agent process. # The close() call must be called in another thread, otherwise # it suicides and ends prematurely. hub.spawn(app_manager.AppManager.get_instance().close)

commit_message:
Warn user if types using es to reindex don't exist

If user specifies --type parameter in index syncing, this will
cause resource types that are explicit specified on the command
line are indexed in ElasticSearch through the associated plugin
making API calls. There is a possibility that old indices or
type mappings are not exist, reindexing these types from es
will result in incomplete index. Add check and
warning for users.

Co-Authored-By: Zhenyu Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I8cd18aa0fa208a91e0b254ed2945923b4d9fa17a
Closes-Bug: #1596710

There may be some data " "corruption in these types, you can specify them in " "--type parameter to renindex data by plugin apis, or " "ignore them by disabling the plugins in configuration " "file." % {'types': ", ".join(empty_types)}) print ("Aborting.") sys.exit(1)

commit_message:
Get rid of DVR inheritance of _delete_current_gw_port

Switch to a callback based approach for cleaning up the
distributed resources for a router gateway. This maintains
the current transactional semantics and gets us closer
to eliminating the use of mixins for DVR.

Change-Id: I1d17706652811383d4bc968812d5cd6526febc4b

subject: Bug fix: When creating a vertex by the evaluator transformer, take only parameters that are not None. Otherwise, a None parameter may overwrite a "real" parameter that already exists on the vertex.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 06:12:25.000000000', 'files': ['vitrage/evaluator/actions/evaluator_event_transformer.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/vitrage/commit/c44748f2e68b9f66f5dd72a3d785748d99afd5a2', 'message': 'Bug fix: When creating a vertex by the evaluator transformer, take only parameters that are not None. Otherwise, a None parameter may overwrite a "real" parameter that already exists on the vertex.

An example:
In case there are two actions on a host: set-state to ERROR and mark-down.
The first vertex update is: vitrage_state=ERROR, is_marked_down=None
The second vertex update is: vitrage_state=None, is_marked_down=True

The second vertex update replaces the ERROR state to with None.
My fix removes the None, so the ERROR state remains as is.

Change-Id: If523bb9c06bcd3bd289f4de956fe737fc573a2da
Closes-Bug: #1645659
(cherry picked from commit 2125293)
'}]
commit_message:
Bug fix: When creating a vertex by the evaluator transformer, take only parameters that are not None. Otherwise, a None parameter may overwrite a "real" parameter that already exists on the vertex.

An example:
In case there are two actions on a host: set-state to ERROR and mark-down.
The first vertex update is: vitrage_state=ERROR, is_marked_down=None
The second vertex update is: vitrage_state=None, is_marked_down=True

The second vertex update replaces the ERROR state to with None.
My fix removes the None, so the ERROR state remains as is.

Change-Id: If523bb9c06bcd3bd289f4de956fe737fc573a2da
Closes-Bug: #1645659
(cherry picked from commit 2125293)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage refs/changes/22/406722/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if VProps.VITRAGE_STATE in event: properties[VProps.VITRAGE_STATE] = \ event.get(VProps.VITRAGE_STATE) if VProps.IS_MARKED_DOWN in event: properties[VProps.IS_MARKED_DOWN] = \ event.get(VProps.IS_MARKED_DOWN)

commit_message:
Don't process/queue children not matched

It seems like children that are unmatched are
still submitted onto the queue (and then they
don't do anything) when we can just avoid that
processing in the first place by just not
submitting them in the first place.

(cherry picked from commit ec8e72df7a9b04a3e5977cf23b12ba1fdf8a1f57)

Change-Id: Id33337f36437cbd6f96e6fd5fd20723e03273ec2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/89/406389/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if image.status == STATUS_UNMATCHED: continue

commit_message:
Spec: Refactor the clients used in protect service

In protection service, both protect and restore operation
use user token passed by context to create clients of other
openstack services and access them by that client. It may
fail to access other services because of the expiration of
user token.

Change-Id: I5279d9b690b2fed0cafb604844555b8b6408b077
Implements: blueprint refactor-clients
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor refs/changes/30/403330/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================ Refactor the clients used in protect service ============================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/karbor/+spec/refactor-clients Problem description =================== As the bug[1] saied, the user token may expire during the process of protectiong when using it directly to access other openstack services. Use Cases ========= In protection service, both protect and restore operationes use user token passed by context to create clients of other openstack services and access them by that client. It may fail to access other services because of the expiration of user token. Proposed change =============== Recently, Keystone has merged a new spec[2] that resolves the issue of token expiration which happens in access between mutiple openstack services. Simply, the principle is like this. When the Keystone Middleware validates the user token, it will check the service token first. If it is passed and valid, then Keystone allows user token to be fetched even if it is expired unless the time exceeds the max window time which is set in Keystone and the default value is 48 hours. It fixes Karbor's issue perfectly. According to that spec, Karbor can access other openstack services successfully for 48 hours which is enough to finish all the protect/restore works. There are some changes to create and use the clients of other services before using that new mechanism. 1. create client The client may be created like this. def create(context): # user_auth_plugin: created by context, which stores the user token. # service_auth_pluing: created and initialized by service information of # Karbor which are registered to Keystone auth_plugin = service_token.ServiceTokenAuthWrapper( user_auth_plugin, service_auth_plugin) session = session.Session(auth=auth_plugin, verify=verify) # endpoint: the public url of cinder client = cinderclient.Client('3', session=session, endpoint_override=endpoint) 2. use client The client can be created once and used all the time until the max expiration time(48h). Alternatives ------------ The 'trust' mechanism of Keystone can solve this issue. But it is a bit more complex than the new one. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- The developers of protect plugins should know these changes. Performance Impact ------------------ It may spend some time to apply a new service token from Keystone if it is expired when using the client to send the request each time. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Work Items ---------- * refactor all clients of other openstack services been using in protect service. Dependencies ============ It depends on all the patches[3] of Kestone to be merged. Testing ======= Unit tests in Karbor. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== [1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/karbor/+bug/1566793 [2] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/ocata/allow-expired.html [3] https://review.openstack.org/#q,topic:bp/allow-expired,n,z

commit_message:
add option to configure cloud-init to allow password authentication

This patch will configure cloud-init to allow password authentication.
This is usefull in case you use "devuser" element and want to ssh guest
image.

Change-Id: I00e38aa2753f26b4cdd34d0fd85fc8e0de78171f

commit_message:
Add UI functional tests to check node and NIC plugin

Implements blueprint nics-and-nodes-attributes-via-plugin

Change-Id: Ia453d42d03368939d52d68362772c92b96a6bdff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ui refs/changes/36/401136/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import pollUntil from 'intern/dojo/node!leadfoot/helpers/pollUntil';import NodeComponent from 'tests/functional/pages/node'; import ModalWindow from 'tests/functional/pages/modal'; var common, clusterPage, settingsPage, node, modal; node = new NodeComponent(this.remote); modal = new ModalWindow(this.remote); .assertElementDisabled('.btn-apply-changes', 'The change is reset successfully') .then(() => clusterPage.goToTab('Dashboard')) .then(() => clusterPage.resetEnvironment(clusterName)) .then(() => clusterPage.goToTab('Settings')); }, 'Check node and NIC plugins'() { var pluginSelector = '.setting-section-plugin_with_node_and_nic_attributes '; return this.remote .clickByCssSelector(pluginSelector + 'h3 input[type=checkbox]') .assertElementPropertyEquals( pluginSelector + '.plugin-versions input[type=radio]:checked', 'value', '5', '1.0.0 node/NIC plugin version is chosen (version ID = 5)' ) .clickByCssSelector('.btn-apply-changes') .then(() => settingsPage.waitForRequestCompleted()) .then(() => clusterPage.goToTab('Nodes')) .then(() => node.openNodePopup()) .clickByCssSelector('#headingattributes') .assertElementExists( '.setting-section-plugin_section_a', 'Section A of node plugin presented in the node pop-up' ) .assertElementDisabled( '.setting-section-plugin_section_a input[name=attribute_b]', 'Attribute B of Section A of node plugin is disabled according to its restrictions' ) .clickByCssSelector('.setting-section-plugin_section_a input[name=attribute_a]') .assertElementEnabled( '.setting-section-plugin_section_a input[name=attribute_b]', 'Attribute B of Section A of node plugin is enabled' ) .clickByCssSelector('.apply-changes:not(:disabled)') .then(() => modal.close()) .clickByCssSelector('.node input[type=checkbox]') .clickByCssSelector('button.btn-configure-interfaces') .assertElementAppears('div.ifc-list', 5000, 'Node interfaces loaded') .then(pollUntil(() => window.$('div.ifc-list').is(':visible') || null, 1000)) .assertElementsExist( '.property-item-container.plugin_with_node_and_nic_attributes', 2, 'NIC plugin presented on the node NICs' ) .assertElementTextEquals( '.property-item-container.plugin_with_node_and_nic_attributes .btn-link', 'Disabled', 'NIC plugin is disabled by default' ) .clickByCssSelector( '.property-item-container.plugin_with_node_and_nic_attributes .btn-link' ) .assertElementDisabled( pluginSelector + 'input[name=attribute_b]', 'Attribute B of NIC plugin is disabled according to its restrictions' ) .clickByCssSelector(pluginSelector + 'input[name=attribute_a]') .assertElementEnabled( pluginSelector + 'input[name=attribute_b]', 'Attribute B of NIC plugin is enabled' ) .assertElementTextEquals( '.property-item-container.plugin_with_node_and_nic_attributes .btn-link', 'Enabled', 'NIC plugin is enabled' ) .clickByCssSelector('.btn-revert-changes') .then(() => clusterPage.goToTab('Settings')) .clickByCssSelector(pluginSelector + '.plugin-versions input[type=radio]:not(:checked)') .clickByCssSelector('.btn-apply-changes') .then(() => settingsPage.waitForRequestCompleted()) .then(() => clusterPage.goToTab('Nodes')) .then(() => node.openNodePopup()) .clickByCssSelector('#headingattributes') .assertElementExists( '.setting-section-plugin_section_a_v2', 'Section A (v2) of node plugin presented in the node pop-up' ) .then(() => modal.close()) .clickByCssSelector('button.btn-configure-interfaces') .assertElementAppears('div.ifc-list', 5000, 'Node interfaces loaded') .then(pollUntil(() => window.$('div.ifc-list').is(':visible') || null, 1000)) .clickByCssSelector( '.property-item-container.plugin_with_node_and_nic_attributes .btn-link' ) .assertElementExists( pluginSelector + 'input[name=attribute_a_v2]', 'Attribute A (v2) of NIC plugin presented' ) .clickByCssSelector('.btn-revert-changes') .then(() => clusterPage.goToTab('Settings')) .clickByCssSelector(pluginSelector + 'h3 input[type=checkbox]') .clickByCssSelector('.btn-apply-changes') .then(() => settingsPage.waitForRequestCompleted()) .then(() => clusterPage.goToTab('Nodes')) .then(() => node.openNodePopup()) .assertElementNotExists('#headingattributes', 'Node plugin was deactivated') .then(() => modal.close()) .clickByCssSelector('button.btn-configure-interfaces') .assertElementAppears('div.ifc-list', 5000, 'Node interfaces loaded') .then(pollUntil(() => window.$('div.ifc-list').is(':visible') || null, 1000)) .assertElementNotExists(pluginSelector, 'NIC plugin was deactivated') .then(() => clusterPage.goToTab('Settings'));
deleted_lines: import 'tests/functional/pages/dashboard'; var common, clusterPage, settingsPage; .assertElementDisabled('.btn-apply-changes', 'The change as reset successfully');

commit_message:
Add plugins with node and NIC attributes to sample_plugins fixture

These plugins are useful for fake UI manual testing and UI functional autotests.

Implements blueprint nics-and-nodes-attributes-via-plugin

Change-Id: I8881cffd50df9c4f969ac4ba64106692d886e9be
(cherry picked from commit 6584232322f70707bef56ab0cbbf7fcd997c2a4e)

commit_message:
Update instance host and task state when post live migration fails

If a live migration fails during the post processing it can lead to
the instance being shutdown on the source node and left in a migrating
task state. The instance is now running on the target node so the
instance host and task state should be updated.

Change-Id: I65c81559c7cbd94094de6f3dd6c8e761de1cb15c
Closes-Bug: #1628606
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/91/379491/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _post_live_migration(self, ctxt, instance, dest, block_migration=False, migrate_data=None): try: self._do_post_live_migration(ctxt, instance, dest, block_migration=block_migration, migrate_data=migrate_data) except Exception: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): node_name = None current_power_state = power_state.RUNNING try: current_power_state = self._get_power_state(ctxt, instance) compute_node = self._get_compute_info(ctxt, dest) node_name = compute_node.hypervisor_hostname except exception.ComputeHostNotFound: LOG.exception(_LE('Failed to get compute_info for %s'), dest) finally: instance.host = dest instance.power_state = current_power_state instance.task_state = None instance.node = node_name instance.progress = 0 instance.save(expected_task_state=task_states.MIGRATING) def _do_post_live_migration(self, ctxt, instance,

commit_message:
[microversion] Bump to 2.39

microversion v2.39 will change the response code of os-migrateLive,
this patch adds supports to that changes.

os-migrateLive will will not alway return a 409 response code when an
attempt is made to live migrate an instance in a rescued state.

Change-Id: I944a5b831ab102d080462af7850629a4d1692cf7
Depends-on: Ie1fc20fe5e028dd53116d5549814442232ddfe49
Implements: blueprint live-migrate-rescued-instances

added_lines: API_MAX_VERSION = api_versions.APIVersion("2.27")

commit_message:
Change the cron-trigger execution time from localtime to UTC

When a cron-trigger is created, in the output, the created time is
shown in UTC but the next execution time is in localtime. It would
be better if both times are shown in the same timezone. This patch
changes the next execution time to UTC.

Change-Id: I7aeb4998769d8210456f22df465ebfea63eef50d
Closes-Bug: #1592164
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/96/406596/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time localtime = croniter.croniter(pattern, start_time).get_next(datetime.datetime) epoch_second = time.mktime(local_time.timetuple()) utc_time = datetime.datetime.utcfromtimestamp(epoch_second) return utc_time datetime.datetime.utcnow() + datetime.timedelta(0, 2) first_second = time.mktime(first_time.timetuple()) first_utc_time = datetime.datetime.utcfromtimestamp(first_second) sum_time = datetime.datetime.utcnow() + datetime.timedelta(0, 60) if sum_time > first_utc_time: first_second = time.mktime(first_time.timetuple()) first_utc_time = datetime.datetime.utcfromtimestamp(first_second) next_time = first_utc_time
deleted_lines: return croniter.croniter(pattern, start_time).get_next(datetime.datetime) datetime.datetime.now() + datetime.timedelta(0, 2) if (datetime.datetime.now() + datetime.timedelta(0, 60)) > first_time: next_time = first_time

unnecessarily complicating the interface specification.

commit_message:
DON'T MERGE: add asssertion for get spec

I'm still wondering why we didn't catch a memory leak[1] in the gate
even though we have the test and I got the failure in local machine.

For now, I'm doubting if the gate does nothing due to a lack of
available testing backend and this patch is for asserting that.

Change-Id: I543cb087f660bc5805d98e264c18e49c3c263e46
1: https://bugs.launchpad.net/pyeclib/+bug/1634006

commit_message:
Change exception type for profile type not found

When a profile type specified is not found from the registry, we should
raise ResourceNotFound exception instead of SpecValidationFailed.

Change-Id: Iae2fe48f5290e5323c22a6d047e04256240f6328

commit_message:
[Dummy driver] Add possibility to set delays for driver methods

Dummy driver was designed to test manila main functionality that is
storage-agnostic. So, add possibility to set delays for each dummy share driver
method, to be able to simulate storage more correctly by having time delays
similar to real storage-drivers.

Two new config options were added:
- dummy_driver_default_driver_method_delay (float)
- dummy_driver_driver_methods_delays (dict of string-keys and int/float values)

Configuration example:

[DEFAULT]
enabled_share_backends = fake_backend_name

[fake_backend_name]
...
dummy_driver_default_driver_method_delay = 2.0
dummy_driver_driver_methods_delays = create_share:5.15,delete_share:1
...

Change-Id: I36598f74762f3631c6c8502148ea9989ad544b5a

commit_message:
angularize cluster tables

This patch implement cluster table and detail page based on angularjs.
As a related patch, I'll implement create/update/delete cluster.

Change-Id: I7fef8e4cd1c377a739a49bd99528add39888b721
Partial-Implements: blueprint angularize-cluster-table
